title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
01:12 <npm> has quit  
01:14 <npm> has joined #xwiki

09:35 <vmassol> tmortagne: would be great if you could solve this one: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-cluster/4/testReport/  
09:35 <vmassol> the failing cluser tests  
09:35 <vmassol> (they've been failing like this for several weeks)  
09:37 <+tmortagne> that's planned yes but did not had time to debug this more during the seminar and looks like something changed in jgroups itself, I need to reproduce it outside of XWiki before sending them a mail  
09:40 <vmassol> I spent 4 hours yesterday trying to fix the delete attachment issue in ImportTest  
09:40 <vmassol> but I've failed to understand it so far....  
09:40 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/3/testReport/  
09:41 <vmassol> I'd need some help on this one  
09:46 <+sburjan> I am working on Annotations  
09:58 <jvelociter> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:23 <SvenDowideit> has quit  
10:25 <SvenDowideit> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <+sburjan> vmassol: found out why the Annotations test is flickering. Pressing ESC does not close the window .. and it fails waitingfor Disappear  
10:33 <+sburjan> and the Actions and Mouse API from Se2 is veryexperimental and will be changed soon.. so I have to find a workaround  
10:35 <vmassol> it's not experimental  
10:35 <vmassol> it was but it's no longer  
10:35 <vmassol> it's strange because I had fixed the ESC issue  
10:36 <+sburjan> well I took 3.2 M1  
10:36 <vmassol> you shouldn't  
10:36 <vmassol> you should take master  
10:37 <vmassol> (obviously)  
10:37 <+sburjan> ok, let's see if ESC works on master (manually pressing it in the browser)  
10:37 <+sburjan> because it seems it's a shortcut issue here. Pressing ESC makes a AJAX request instead of closing the window  
10:38 <+sburjan> let me check  
10:49 <+sburjan> vmassol: it's not fixed  
10:50 <+sburjan> let me check the sources on github  
10:55 <+sburjan> same in source code. ok. Thing is: you have an annotation label in front of you. press ESC, doesn't go away. Instead, it is refreshed.  
10:55 <+sburjan> tried it also manually  
10:55 <+sburjan> so it's not the fault of the test  
11:06 <+sburjan> refreshed cache, ESC is okay now, but the test still hangs there  
11:06 <+sburjan> investigating

14:06 <vmassol> sburjan: back  
14:07 <vmassol> back trying to understand why attachment deletion in ImportTest is failing…. any help is most welcome....  
14:09 <vmassol> guys I need help with stabilizing the build  
14:09 <vmassol> it's important we get it working  
14:10 <vmassol> would be great if you helped me stabilize it  
14:10 <vmassol> I need someone to look at fixing invitationtest failing tests: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/10/testReport/  
14:10 <vmassol> + someone to work on failing cluser tests  
14:11 <+sburjan> I'm stuck in the Annotations.. I will have to find a hack that doesn;t slow the test down and enough elegant for you to like it ;)  
14:12 <+tmortagne> vmassol: already said I will take care of clustering test but its not a quickfix  
14:12 <@cjdelisle> Good morning, looking at invitation tests since I know them pretty well.  
14:12 <vmassol> ok if you're working actively on it  it's fine...  
14:12 <vmassol> (re tmortagne)  
14:13 <vmassol> hi cjdelisle, ok thanks  
14:14 <vmassol> now that leaves ImportTest on which I'vr already spent 6 hours without progressing....  
14:14 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I reproduced it but no idea what could be the issue either  
14:15 <vmassol> tmortagne: you reproduced with the test or manually?  
14:15 <+tmortagne> no by executing them several time with the new annotation you introduced for tests  
14:15 <vmassol> ok  
14:16 <+tmortagne> random failure at database level is not the easiest thing to debug...

15:28 <vmassol> (actually xwiki-platform-core isn't that big)  
15:36 <+jvelociter> 20 minutes after, doesn't sound such a good idea  
15:36 <+tmortagne> big enough to not do it twice :)  
15:36 <+jvelociter> maybe I shouldn't have "build automatically turned on"  
15:37 <+tmortagne> yep you should probably enabled that after since I think it tries to build right after you import each project and blocks following imports  
15:44 <Enygma`> has quit  
15:52 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
16:04 <vmassol> cjdelisle: I'm getting the following when starting my XE (just build enterprise):  
16:04 <vmassol> 2011-08-04 16:03:52,541 [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/] ERROR c.x.x.p.w.WatchListPlugin      - init  
16:04 <vmassol> com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 0 in 0: Failed to run query for watchlist jobs.  
16:04 <vmassol> Wrapped Exception: Exception while execute query. Query statement = [getWatchlistJobDocuments]  
16:05 <@cjdelisle> Are you sure oldcore version is up to date?  
16:05 <vmassol> maybe not, I just built it but maybe I didn't git pull first  
16:05 <vmassol> checking  
16:09 <vmassol> ok better, sorry for the false alarm  
16:16 <@cjdelisle> heh it happened to me too  
16:42 <+sburjan> ok, it seems that mouseOUT does not trigger when running the test. I am also able to manually bypass it in 1 of 5 attempts. So it's something related to mouseOUT event in js. I have also tried 2 ways to do this in SE2, none of them works  
16:47 <vmassol> sburjan: i had fixed all this  
16:47 <vmassol> so it's strange  
16:47 <vmassol> ah wait  
16:48 <vmassol> it's possible I didn't commit my last changes  
16:48 <+sburjan> can you check please ?  
16:48 <+sburjan> because I see no changes in the AnnotationsLabel.java  
16:50 <vmassol> I can give you the patch I have  
16:50 <vmassol> which I didn't commit  
16:50 <vmassol> I didn't commit because it was solving one thing but the test was still failing somewhere else thereafter  
16:51 <+sburjan> give me the patch please .. let's hope I understand it :)  
16:51 <vmassol> but at least it fixed the ESC issue  
16:51 <+sburjan> I need a fix for the ESC issue  
16:51 <+sburjan> I'm sure there are 3-4 lines I need  
16:51 <vmassol> it's a bit more complex  
16:51 <+sburjan> please send the patch  
16:52 <vmassol> done  
16:52 <+sburjan> thx  
16:52 <vmassol> basically  
16:52 <vmassol> I used the advanced user interaction api to move the mouse \*\*inside\*\* the annotation box  
16:52 <vmassol> so that esc work  
16:53 <vmassol> I didn't commit because I wasn't fully happy about the whole thing and in the end I wanted to refactor completely the whole test before going further  
16:53 <vmassol> hope it can help you/give you some ideas  
17:14 <+lucaa> vmassol: where did you move the mouse inside the annotation box?  
17:14 <+lucaa> patch line number, please  
17:14 <vmassol> lucaa: you're working with sburjan?  
17:14 <+sburjan> yes  
17:15 <vmassol> +        // Move mouse to annotation icon  
17:15 <vmassol> +        Actions builder = new Actions(getDriver().getWrappedDriver());  
17:15 <vmassol> +        builder.moveToElement(annotationIcon).build().perform();  
17:15 <+lucaa> that's the icon, not the box  
17:15 <+lucaa> I don't understand  
17:15 <vmassol> yep but the box includes it  
17:15 <vmassol> that's what happens when you do it manually  
17:15 <+lucaa> yes, but if you stay there, the box reappears  
17:16 <+lucaa> after you close it  
17:16 <+lucaa> we applied your patch and well, it doesn't work  
17:16 <vmassol> hmm I didn't see this in my etsts  
17:16 <+lucaa> so I'm trying to understand  
17:16 <+lucaa> well we saw that manually  
17:16 <vmassol> it would be strange  
17:16 <+lucaa> and it also makes sense  
17:16 <vmassol> if you do it manually  
17:16 <+lucaa> which browser  
17:16 <+lucaa> ?  
17:16 <vmassol> I don't remeber seeing the box reappear without moving the mouse  
17:16 <vmassol> FF 3.6  
17:17 <+lucaa> we'll call you  
17:17 <+lucaa> can we?  
17:17 <vmassol> I'm on something else  
17:17 <vmassol> again  
17:17 <vmassol> this is just to help you  
17:17 <vmassol> if it doesn't don't use it  
17:17 <+lucaa> we're just trying to understand how it worked for you  
17:17 <vmassol> it worked for me but I didn't commit it since it wasn't good enough, was breaking somewhere else  
17:17 <vmassol> and I couldn't understand  
17:17 <+lucaa> cool  
17:17 <vmassol> why in some tests I had to move the mouse  
17:18 <vmassol> while in others it was making the test fail  
17:18 <vmassol> and I had to do it as it was before  
17:18 <vmassol> but at least it was solving the ESC for me  
17:18 <vmassol> was breaking after that part somewhere else  
17:18 <vmassol> I don't fully remember the details  
17:19 <vmassol> I wanted to refactor cleanly the test before working on it again  
17:19 <vmassol> making it PO  
17:19 <vmassol> as I had the intuition that the new pb I had  
17:19 <vmassol> was caused by some reuse of instanes which shouldn't be reused  
17:19 <vmassol> (caused by not following the PO strategy)  
17:20 <+lucaa> ok, we'll figure it out  
17:20 <vmassol> gl it's not an easy test  
17:22 <+lucaa> anyone knows how to check when did a test start failing? (on jenkins)  
17:31 <vmassol> lucaa: you cannot  
17:31 <vmassol> since we only keep the last 10 runs  
17:31 <+lucaa> ah ok  
17:31 <+lucaa> cool  
17:32 <+lucaa> </sarcastic>  
17:33 <vmassol> for the anno test, it used to flicker but it started failing all the time when I fixed most flickering by using the timeout on findElement which also was at the same time I moved to SE 2.0 final AFAIR  
17:36 <+sburjan> the main issue is that it hangs on waiting the annotationLabel to disappear  
17:55 <vmassol> cjdelisle: any luck with invitationtest?  
17:56 <@cjdelisle> runs fine on my computer, Looks like perhaps a problem binding the port.  
17:57 <vmassol> yes, did you check the 3025 port on agent3?  
17:57 <vmassol> (tmortagne: when you checked yesteday was it on agent3?)  
17:57 <vmassol> cjdelisle: should greenamil report an error if it can't bind the port?  
17:57 <vmassol> (because i don't see any log in the console about such an error)  
17:57 <vmassol> (I saw only problem when sending mail to that port - which seems to indicate greenmail waasn't running)  
17:58 <@cjdelisle> I thought it would which was what immedietly lead me to suspect iptables issues but that makes no sense as nothing would be working.  
17:58 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I checked on whatever agent is was failing, don't remember if it was agent-3 or 1  
17:58 <vmassol> was agent3  
17:59 <+tmortagne> problem is that it can't connect so if there is something holding this port it's not SMTP for sure  
17:59 <vmassol> cjdelisle: it worked on agent-2 here: http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Functional%20Tests/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/8/testReport/

18:04 <Chami1> now I'm developing a search component  
18:05 <+jvelociter> lucaa: hi  
18:05 <+jvelociter> do you have a minute ?\

18:05 <+tmortagne> ( Chami1 )

18:09 <+tmortagne> any case what's important before you finish I think is:  
18:09 <+tmortagne> - setup proper integration test and provide some tests  
18:09 <+tmortagne> - document android client on http://extensions.xwiki.org  
18:09 <Chami1> has quit  
18:13 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
18:13 <+tmortagne> Chami1: did you seen my last message (starting with "any case what's important...")  
18:13 <Chami1> tmortagne: sorry disconnected. should I implement a page editor? another thing. xwiki navigator(tree style) is too slow to navigate. I'll look for an alternative  
18:15 <+tmortagne> Chami1: in any case what's important before you finish I think is:  
18:15 <+tmortagne> - setup proper integration test and provide some tests and make easy as possible to add more  
18:15 <+tmortagne> - document android client on http://extensions.xwiki.org  
18:15 <+tmortagne> - make sure what you already have is as stable as possible  
18:18 <Chami1> yeah. I have to improve the performance in some cases.  
18:19 <Chami1> can you suggest me a good example documentation on http://extensions.xwiki.org  
18:21 <+tmortagne> Chami1: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Cache+Module  
18:21 <+tmortagne> but don't follow it too closely since it's very different from what you have  
18:23 <Chami1> ok, thanks. I'll go through several extensions and make my own :)  
18:23 <+tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Observation+Module is nice too  
18:23 <vmassol> tmortagne: seems you broke all func tests with the executor  
18:24 <vmassol> for ex: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-misc/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-misc/11/testReport/org.xwiki.test.integration/XWikiTestSetup/junit\_framework\_TestSuite\_16acdd1/  
18:25 <+tmortagne> checking, probably miss a if on null value  
18:26 <Chami1> tmortagne: thnx. I'll continue. bye for now.  
18:26 <+tmortagne> Chami1: bye  
18:27 <@cjdelisle> hudsonagent@node3:~$ while [ 1 ]; do lsof | grep LISTEN | grep '3025'; sleep 5; done  
18:27 <@cjdelisle> see if it's listening on ip6 or something...  
18:27 <+tmortagne> vmassol: should be ok now

18:34 <+jvelociter> it does not seem to be the case anymore : http://incubator.myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/TestAnnotations  
18:36 <+lucaa> vmassol: fyi we found it, apparently for some SF reason mouseOver is being sent twice and 2 annotation details windows are being displayed. Therefore you need to send the escape key twice  
18:37 <+lucaa> jvelociter: no  
18:37 <+lucaa> not in this version of annos, in the first proto made by lucien we did  
18:37 <+jvelociter> ok  
18:37 <+jvelociter> fair enough

18:46 <+sburjan> \*lucaa  
18:46 <vmassol> cool  
18:47 <+sburjan> but I didn't use your patch ..  
18:47 <+sburjan> I will merge them as best as I can  
18:47 <+sburjan> and commit  
18:47 <vmassol> commit?  
18:47 <+sburjan> on my fork  
18:47 <vmassol> my patch is probably not needed with the big refactoring anyway  
18:47 <vmassol> ok  
18:48 <+sburjan> I made a lot of refactorings, changed names, etc  
18:48 <+sburjan> this is why I'd keep my version  
18:48 <+sburjan> gonna run the test with clover so we don;t have unused code  
19:01 <+jvelociter> guys  
19:01 <+jvelociter> what's the policy to exclude classes from clirr ?  
19:02 <vmassol> jvelociter: that we agree to break the backward compat of the api  
19:03 <vmassol> the important depends on the important of the api  
19:03 <+jvelociter> vmassol: by default it only runs in outside /internal/ ?  
19:03 <+tmortagne> jvelociter: they are listed in platform-core pom file  
19:03 <vmassol> yes outside internal  
19:03 <+jvelociter> ok  
19:03 <+jvelociter> I think what I'm breaking should have been in internal in the first place  
19:04 <+tmortagne> so that it's easier to cleanup the list after releasing  
19:04 <+jvelociter> (plumbing changes for the restlet upgrade)  
19:04 <vmassol> jvelociter: you can discuss it on the list (the removal of the api)  
19:04 <+tmortagne> jvelociter: but your restlet upgrade has not been merged ?  
19:04 <vmassol> it was rolled back  
19:04 <+jvelociter> tmortagne: merged then reverted  
19:04 <+tmortagne> then you don't care  
19:04 <+jvelociter> but I found a way to work with the issue  
19:05 <+tmortagne> it does not exist so you can't break anything  
19:05 <+jvelociter> so I'm going to push it again :)  
19:05 <+tmortagne> don't even see how clirr can work at all for you  
19:06 <+jvelociter> you mean locally ?  
19:07 <+tmortagne> I mean clirr is supposed to compare with a previously release version, it should not find anything coming from you upgrade  
19:07 <+jvelociter> I don't understand  
19:07 <+jvelociter> the rest module was previously released  
19:08 <+jvelociter> I made change to it for the upgrade to work  
19:08 <+jvelociter> so this change are reported not compatible with the previous version  
19:08 <jvdrean> has quit  
19:08 <+tmortagne> I know but the way you said it I understood you are breaking something you introduce in your previous upgrade try  
19:08 <+tmortagne> so I did not seen how clirr could see that  
19:09 <+jvelociter> well no of course not
